abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Economic Governance Reform Operation Project (EGRO) was
            support the Government's efforts to adopt measures that
            will increase the transparency of, and efficiency in the use
            of public resources, and external assistance with the
            increasing participation of the private sector, and civil
            society in decision-making, and the provision of services.
            Project ratings are as follows: Project outcome is
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome is satisfactory;
            Bank performance is satisfactory; and overall Borrower
            performance is satisfactory. The report cites the following
            as lessons learned: 1) Choice of lending instrument, the
            decision to do a two-tranche structural adjustment operation
            was adequate in view of the possible risks affecting the
            operation, 2) Client commitment, the successful
            implementation of the Government's program followed
            from its ownership and degree of commitment. 3)
            Institutional capacity, experience with the implementation
            of the EGRO has shown that the choice of its tranche
            conditionality was judiciously selective, focusing on those
            measures that were likely to make the greatest impact, were
            critical to the successful achievement of the program
            objectives and enjoyed broad Government support; donor
            coordination. As mentioned earlier, close coordination among
            donors in the provision of financial and technical
            assistance greatly contributed to the outcome of the reform
            program. The lessons detailed above are being taken into
            account for the preparation of EGRO II.
